intro: Catoblastus sphaerocarpus, commonly known as the globe-fruit or spherical fruit plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spherical fruits, which are covered in a thick, waxy layer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Catoblastus sphaerocarpus is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
